title: Won't Start
description: Diagnose a no-start condition on the Kymco People S 125i scooter, covering battery, starter, fuel, and ignition.

nodes.text: What happens when you press the start button on your People S 125i?

options.text: Lights work but starter doesn't engage
Starter cranks but engine doesn't fire

nodes.warning: Wear eye protection near the battery. Battery acid is corrosive.
nodes.instructions: Locate the battery under the seat of the People S 125i. Measure across terminals with a multimeter (DC volts). A healthy battery reads 12.4V+. Below 12.0V the starter won't have enough power. Clean corroded terminals with a wire brush. The People S 125i uses a 12V sealed battery (typically YTX7A-BS or equivalent).

nodes.warning: Turn ignition off before checking fuses.
nodes.instructions: Check the main fuse (15-20A) and all secondary fuses near the battery. Remove and inspect each — the metal strip should be intact. Replace blown fuses with the same rating only.

nodes.text: Check kill switch and safety interlocks
nodes.instructions: The People S 125i safety interlocks: (1) Kill switch must be in RUN position, (2) Side stand must be retracted, (3) A brake lever may need to be squeezed while pressing start. Toggle the kill switch several times. Make sure the side stand retracts fully and its switch engages.

nodes.warning: Do not bypass the relay unless you understand the risk.
nodes.instructions: Listen for a click from the relay near the battery when pressing start. Click but no crank = starter motor issue. No click = wiring or switch fault upstream. Check for 12V at the relay trigger wire while pressing start.

options.text: No click — no voltage at trigger

nodes.warning: Fuel is flammable. No open flames near fuel system.
nodes.instructions: Turn ignition ON — listen for the fuel pump priming (2-3 second whir). If no sound, check the fuel pump fuse. Verify fuel is in the tank. The People S 125i is fuel-injected and requires proper fuel pump operation.

nodes.warning: High voltage — do not touch plug wire or coil while cranking.
nodes.instructions: Remove the spark plug, reconnect to cap, ground against engine with insulated pliers. Crank and look for bright blue spark. Weak or no spark = ignition fault. The People S 125i uses CDI ignition, typically with an NGK CR7HSA plug.

nodes.action: Charge with a smart charger or replace if it won't hold charge.
nodes.details: Use a 1-2 amp charger. Replace if it won't hold 12.4V. Check charging system (13.5-14.8V at 3,000 RPM) if battery dies again. Scooter batteries last 2-3 years.
If it blows again immediately, there is a short circuit. Trace the wiring to find the damaged section.

nodes.action: The safety switch was preventing starting.
nodes.details: Clean switch contacts with contact cleaner. Ensure side stand retracts fully. Apply dielectric grease to connectors.

nodes.warning: Do not disassemble unless comfortable with electrical work.
nodes.action: Check starter cable connection first, then replace starter if needed.
nodes.details: Check the heavy cable at the motor for looseness or corrosion. If secure, the motor has failed (worn brushes or seized). Starter motors for the People S 125i are available and affordable.

nodes.action: Trace start circuit wiring to find the break.
nodes.details: Check: start button connector, handlebar switch cluster, side stand switch connector, brake switch. Water ingress into switches is common on scooters.

nodes.warning: Fire risk — do not run fuel pump outside the tank.
nodes.action: Check fuel pump fuse and connector. Replace pump if failed.
nodes.details: Check fuse first, then check for 12V at the pump connector. If voltage present but pump silent, the pump has failed. Running tank very low kills pump life.
The People S 125i has approximately a 7-liter tank. Wait for pump to prime after refueling. May take extra cranks after running dry.

nodes.warning: CDI and coil handle high voltage.
nodes.action: Replace spark plug first, then check CDI, coil, and pickup.
nodes.details: New plug (NGK CR7HSA, gap 0.6-0.7mm) is the simplest fix. If still no spark: check coil for cracks, test CDI, check pickup coil resistance. Faulty CDI is common on Kymco scooters.

nodes.warning: Compression test requires removing spark plug.
nodes.details: Should produce 10-12 bar (145-175 PSI). Low compression = worn rings, head gasket leak, or tight valves. Check valve clearances (intake 0.10mm, exhaust 0.15mm). Tight valves are a common no-start cause.
